Class XmlIndexLookup

The XmlIndexLookup class encapsulates the context within which an index lookup operation can be performed on a Container object.

Inheritance
System.Object
XmlIndexLookup
Implements
System.IDisposable
Inherited Members
System.Object.ToString()
System.Object.Equals(System.Object)
System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.GetHashCode()
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public sealed class XmlIndexLookup : IDisposable
Remarks

The lookup is performed using an XmlIndexLookup object, and a series of methods of that object that specify how the lookup is to be performed. Using these methods, it is possible to specify inequality lookups, range lookups, and simple value lookups, as well as the sort order of the results.

By default, results are returned in the sort order of the index. XmlIndexLookup objects are created using CreateIndexLookup(Container, String, String, String, XmlValue, IndexLookupOperation).

A constructed, read-only object may be shared among threads for multiple calls to Execute(QueryContext).

Property Value
Type Description
HighboundOperationLookup

The operation to be used for the upper bound for a range index lookup operation.
Remarks

The high bound must be specified to indicate a range lookup.

View Source

LowBoundOperation

Gets the operation to be used for the index lookup operation.

Declaration
public IndexLookupOperation LowBoundOperation { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
IndexLookupOperation

The operation to be used for the index lookup operation.
Remarks

If the operation is a simple inequality lookup, the lower bound is used as the single value and operation for the lookup. If the operation is a range lookup, in which an upper bound is specified, the lower bound is used as the lower boundary value and operation for the lookup.

See Also
IndexLookupOperation

SetHighBound(XmlValue, HighboundOperationLookup)

Sets the operation and value to be used for the upper bound for a range index lookup operation.

Declaration
public void SetHighBound(XmlValue value, HighboundOperationLookup op)
Parameters
Type Name Description
XmlValue value

The value to be used for the upper bound. Use of an empty value results in an inequality lookup, rather than a range lookup.
HighboundOperationLookup op

The operation to be used on the upper bound.
Remarks

The high bound must be specified to indicate a range lookup.

See Also
XmlValue

SetLowBound(XmlValue, IndexLookupOperation)

Sets the operation and value to be used for the index lookup operation.

Declaration
public void SetLowBound(XmlValue value, IndexLookupOperation op)
Parameters
Type Name Description
XmlValue value

The value to be used for the lower bound. An empty value is specified using an uninitialized XmlValue object.
IndexLookupOperation op

The operation to be performed.
Remarks

If the operation is a simple inequality lookup, the lower bound is used as the single value and operation for the lookup. If the operation is a range lookup, in which an upper bound is specified, the lower bound is used as the lower boundary value and operation for the lookup.

See Also
XmlValue
IndexLookupOperation

Type Name Description

The namespace of the node to be used.
System.String nodeName

The name of the element or attribute node to be used.
Remarks

The default namespace is selected by passing an empty string for the namespace.

SetParent(String, String)

Sets the name of the parent node to be used for an edge index lookup operation.

Declaration
public void SetParent(string parentNamespace, string parentNodeName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String parentNamespace

The namespace of the parent node to be used.
System.String parentNodeName

The name of the element or attribute node to be used.
Remarks

If the index is not an edge index, this configuration is ignored.The default namespace is used by passing an empty string for the namespace.
